mechanosensation.notes: As sponges, Agelasidae likely possess mechanosensory abilities to detect water currents and particle movement for filter feeding.

chemoreception.notes: Sponges rely on chemoreception to identify food particles and avoid harmful substances in the water.

photosensitivity.notes: It is unknown if Agelasidae sponges have specific light-sensing capabilities beyond potential indirect responses to light-related environmental changes.
